challenge.description: Difficulty in synthesizing high-quality single crystals of LiMn2O4.
challenge.impact: Poor quality single crystals hinder accurate structural and physical property investigations.

solution.description: Use of LiCl as a flux material with a controlled evaporation speed at high temperatures.
solution.methodology: Solvent evaporation flux method with a nominal weight ratio of LiMn2O4:LiCl = 1:8, heated at 1173 K for 10 days in a covered gold crucible.
solution.effectiveness: Successfully produced high-quality single crystals with ideal spinel structure and high crystallinity.

evidence.data: SEM-EDX analysis confirmed absence of gold contamination; ICP spectroscopy confirmed stoichiometric composition; X-ray diffraction confirmed cubic spinel structure.

context.material_properties: Cubic spinel structure with Fd%3m space group and lattice parameter of a = 8.2483 Å.
context.experimental_conditions: Heating at 1173 K for 10 days with controlled evaporation speed of LiCl flux.
context.application_relevance: High-quality single crystals are essential for studying structural and physical properties relevant to lithium-ion battery electrodes.

challenge.description: Powder diffraction techniques do not fully resolve the true crystal symmetry and structural transition mechanism.
challenge.impact: Incomplete understanding of the structural phase transition and physical properties of the material.

solution.description: Use of single-crystal X-ray diffraction to clarify crystal symmetry and structural parameters.
solution.methodology: Single-crystal X-ray diffraction experiments conducted at various temperatures using a four-circle diffractometer and nitrogen gas flow cryostat.
solution.effectiveness: Successfully identified the orthorhombic structure at low temperatures and confirmed the structural phase transition around 285 K.

evidence.data: Temperature-dependent X-ray diffraction peak profiles showed peak splitting and additional superlattice reflections below the transition temperature.

context.material_properties: Orthorhombic structure with tripled periodicity along a- and b-axis directions at low temperatures.
context.experimental_conditions: Temperature range of 230–330 K with stable temperature control at 0.5 K.
context.application_relevance: Understanding structural transitions is critical for optimizing the material's performance in lithium-ion battery applications.
